CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 1, 1947, pg. 18, reads: "Pretty Wedding - Miss Gladys Lockhart, daughter of Mrs. Mamie Lockhart of Manchester, N. S. became the bride of Charles Lonon [London], son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel London of Perry Street, in a pretty wedding held at Allen Chapel Church Feb. 11. The bride was given in marriage by her uncle Horace Lumpkin, and wore a gown with a full train. Miss Dorothy Wilson was matron of honor. Elenora Richardson, Ethel Bryant, Bertha Wilson and Hamie Hughes were bridesmaids. Judith Wilson was flower girl. Joseph White was best man. Ushers included Paul Witherspoon, Earl Armstrong, Irwin Banks and Theodore Matlock. Miss Mable Evans was soloist. Mrs. Crunkleton was pianist. The Rev. S. Keyes officiated. Hostesses at a reception which followed were Mrs. Willie Mae White, the bride's aunt, and the bride's mother. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Groom Charles London and bride Gladys Lockhart posed cutting wedding cake and surrounded by guests, in interior with floral wallpaper
